title: journal pacifique - automated multilingual science blog

body.content: The idea behind journalpacifique (peaceful journal) was to make the information easily and readily accessible in their own languages for as many people as possible.

To achieve this I wrote a python script that parses royalty free science articles and translates them to different languages using google translate. The script then forms static html files (for all languages x all articles) and publishes them on the website.
The website was updates with a script that ran when I started up my personal computer, a primite form of unreliable cronjob.

I choose the languages I translated into carefully, I have evaluated the highest bard-scored languages, then among them, I chose four languages with the lowest rate of ESL speakers among their respective native speakers.
I took down the website but you can check out the spaghetti code.
